dataset_id: CMS: Global Carbon Fluxes Associated with Livestock Feed and Emissions, 2000-2013
title: CMS: Global Carbon Fluxes Associated with Livestock Feed and Emissions, 2000-2013
summary: This data set provides global annual carbon flux estimates, at 0.05-degree resolution, associated with livestock feed intake, manure, manure management, respiration, and enteric fermentation, summed over all livestock types. These fluxes can be summed across multiple grid cells to obtain totals for any given areas. These 2000-2013 flux estimates were based on livestock populations reported by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and the United States Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Statistics Service (USDA NASS), on coefficients provided by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), and on additional coefficients developed by the authors.

citation: Kanno, Y., M.A. Kulp, S.E. Moore, and G.D. Grossman. 2017. Native brook trout and invasive rainbow trout respond differently to seasonal weather variation: Spawning timing matters. Freshwater Biology. 62(5):868-879.
